verses.roman:
āmi gaṅgā-pathe āilāṅa, tiṅho rāja-pathe
ataeva āmāra dekhā nahila tāṅra sāthe

synonyms: āmi—I; gaṅgā-pathe—on the path on the bank of the Ganges; āilāṅa—I came; tiṅho—he; rāja-pathe—on the public road; ataeva—therefore; āmāra—my; dekhā—meeting; nahila—was not possible; tāṅra sāthe—with him.
translation: I came by the path on the bank of the Ganges, whereas Sanātana Gosvāmī came by the public road. Therefore we did not meet.
